title: Rainham Marshes Walks and Cycling

images.title: Oxymoron / Drainage Channel on Rainham Marshes
images.caption: Drainage Channel on Rainham Marshes. The channel on the right drains the marshes into the Thames via a sluice; the white concrete structure on the left in the distance carries the new high speed train line to the channel tunnel.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Looking west towards Hornchurch. The wind turbines in the background are in TQ5081, on the Hornchurch Marshes

images.title: Kenneth Yarham / Channel Tunnel Rail Link at Rainham Marshes RSPB Reserve
images.caption: Channel Tunnel Rail Link at Rainham Marshes RSPB Reserve. Taken from one of the boardwalks on Rainham Marshes RSPB Reserve (actually on Aveley Marshes), the CTRL is on a viaduct here to take it over the C2C line between Rainham and Purfleet.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Cyleway 13 & Rainham to Purfleet Path, Aveley Marshes. The hill ahead is the Rainham landfill site.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Distance post on the Rainham to Purfleet Path across the Aveley Marshes

description: This circular walk or cycle explores the RSPB Rainham Marshes Nature Reserve in London. It's an easy route using part of National Cycle Route 13 and other signed trails. The route runs mostly along a riverside path by the River Thames from Purfleet to Rainham and a trail through the centre of the reserve. The reserve has a variety of regular winged visitors, including peregrines, lapwings and wild ducks. There are also water voles and rare dragonflies to be seen across the boardwalks. Also take time to explore the visitor centre which has a wealth of information about the area. This route is easily accesible with train stations at either end at Purfleet and Rainham. You can also hire bikes at the reserve.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Part of this route uses a section of the long distance London Loop. You could follow the waymarked path north to visit Hornchurch Country Park, the Ingrebourne Valley and the nearby town of Upminster. Just east of Hornchurch there's also the noteworthy Belhus Woods Country Park where you'll find lakes, wildflower meadows and bluebell woodland. For more walking ideas in the area see the London Walks page.

display_address: Capstan Drive, Rainham, London Borough of Havering, London, Greater London, England, RM13 9JA, United Kingdom
